abilitygroupdescription.p: Wyrd Science is based on five sacred pillars: Biology, Electrochemistry, Blaylock Valves, Humoural Theory, and Leeches. Upon this foundation great minds strive to create a brave new world.

abilitycheck.critfail: You succeed in entering the trance but remain in a death like state for longer than you intended.

abilitydescription.p: The character can enter a death-like state through a special meditative trance. This state should convince people that the character is dead under cursory examination.

The character has worked out how to control reanimated humans using wyrd science and brain implants. In order to create a Flesh Golem the character needs access to a laboratory. Flesh Golems behave like Homonculi but are much much larger.

When assisting in combat a flesh golem has 20 hit points, 10 stamina, an armour of +2. They attack using their bare hands with +3 to hit and do damage of 2d10 (they are not very coordinated but quite strong). Flesh Golems love fighting and their master must make a Mettle DC2 check to control them when any physical combat begins or the flesh golem will automatically attack. A similar check may be made to control the Flseh Golem when they get excited for other reasons.
In all other ways Flesh Golems behave as if they were homunculi.

The character is able to create a 50cm20" tall humanoid servitor from flesh. The homunculus has a mental link with its creator but has limited intelligence. The homonculus always knows where its master is and will be able to find its master when it pleases. It is capable of running errands and assisting in combat. Homunculi must do what their creator tells them, unless they get really excited. Homunculi are very hard to contain. They often escape from enclosures through unknown devious means.

When creating an homunculus a character gathers the requisite material, off-cuts from a fresh corpse, a variety of alchemical reagents and a manual for the binding, They make the check to create the homoculus. If they fail the ingredients are wasted and must be destroyed. If successful the creation will rise within a few hours. An homunculus can have only one master. It will only do as directed by others if it feels its master would want that. If someone creates two homuculi they will both try and destroy the other. This never ends well.

When assisting in combat the homunculus has 3 hit points, no stamina, an armour of +2 (they're small and nasty) and provides a +1 to hit and damage bonus to one character fighting in melee hand to hand. That character need not be its master. Homunculi love fighting and their master must make a Mettle DC2 check to control them when any physical combat begins or the homuculus will automatically attack. A similar check may be made to control the homunculus when they get excited for other reasons.

Homonculi are basically an ambulatory fetish, possessed by some minor demon from beyond. Their actions are strongly curtailed by the rigourous, standardized and very lengthy binding that is part of their creation ritual. However, homoculi frequently resort to type, eating the flesh of humans or excrement when they can, laughing loudly at the misfortune of others, and if left on their own the might resort to theft, or the mutilation of animals. They have been known to murder small children or light fires, but it is believed that all such loopholes have now been covered in their binding ritual.

Homoculi attract a certain amount of attention. Clothes should be made for them so as not to attract more attention than is absolutely necessary as their bodies are hideous. Alternatively they may be carried around in a box.

Thankfully, homonculi do not talk a great deal. When they do they usually being sycophantic, or sarcastic. They delight in the misfortune of others which really excites them. They may get jealous if their master pays too much attention to others.

Homunculi do not really die unless their body is destroyed beyond recognition, is burned or eaten . They can be healed by simply sewing them back together. If someone chooses to do this they will regain all health after a long rest.

The character has worked out how to control rats using wyrd science and brain implants. In order to create a Wyrd Rat the character needs access to a laboratory. Wyrd Rats have a telepathic bond with their master, they can perform minor tasks and can attack on command. Wyrd Rats have HP:1, AC:13+Rank, Bite DC:13+Rank, Dmg:1. They can try to create a Wyrd Rat once per day. If they fail, the rat survives but it is impossible to make a telepathic link with the creature. Each day spent in preparation gives the character +1 to their check, up to a maximum of +3. They get an additional +1 for naming the rat, which strengthens the chance that the telepathic bond will hold. The character can have and control up to Rank Wyrd Rats after this it is impossible for the character to maintain the telepathic link with the rats.

If the extra limb is an arm it grants an extra hand to the character not an extra action. So for example, they might be able to use a two handed weapon and a shield, or hold a bomb and a sword and a torch.
